pr_title: System program management service to ensure system programs are working as expected

timeline.message: System program management service to ensure system programs are working as expected

timeline.bodyText:
Please override the executor() method to use daemon thread and the shutdown method for executor termination.
Alternative, you can extend from the AbstractRetryableScheduledService instead. It uses daemon thread, and handle failure retries and logging.
timeline.author: chtyim

replies.bodyText: Going with first option. Since we run this service very frequently, are retries required on each iteration?
replies.author: greeshmaswaminathan

replies.bodyText: The retry strategy simply provide a different delay than the regular one for the next iteration to run. E.g. if it runs regularly at 10 seconds interval, upon failure, you can do an exponential increase of the interval (e.g. 1, 2, 4, 8) till a max depending on the failure type.
replies.author: chtyim

timeline.bodyText: Is the Map<String, String> the runtime arguments? If it is, you need to copy the map as well. Better yet, use the Arguments interface.
timeline.author: chtyim

timeline.bodyText: No need to copy again since in the set method you always replace with a new Map copy.
timeline.author: chtyim

timeline.bodyText: You can just keep a Set<ProgramRunId> for programRunsToStop.
timeline.author: chtyim

timeline.bodyText: It is better to list all program types instead of hardcoded to SERVICE.
timeline.author: chtyim

timeline.bodyText: All similar method should use program instead of service (e.g. stopProgram)
timeline.author: chtyim

timeline.bodyText:
Please log with more context. E.g. "LOG.warn(Could not stop program {}. Will be retried", programId, ex).
Also, it should be logged as warning since it is not a fatal error and it will get retried.
timeline.author: chtyim

timeline.bodyText:
These two lines can be combined as:
programRunsMap.computeIfAbsent(programId, k -> new ArrayList<>()).add(runtimeInfo);
timeline.author: chtyim

timeline.bodyText: Why need to load the run record? The runId has time encoded in it. You can simply order the runs by timestamp. See RunIds.getTime() method.
timeline.author: chtyim

timeline.bodyText: You don't need this. Just do a enabledProgramsMap.contains(programId) check
